name: rho CrB
scenarioDescription:
The rho CrB Exoplanetary System

rho CrB is a star with 0.89 times the mass of the Sun, and 1.36 times its radius. It is located 57.01 light years away from the solar system.

rho CrB is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

rho CrB b

rho CrB b was discovered by the Fred Lawrence Whipple Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 1997-07. Its semi-major axis is 0.22 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 39.85 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, rho CrB.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.0373, which means that when rho CrB b is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.21 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 0.23. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of rho CrB b is 332.08 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, rho CrB b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.

rho CrB c

rho CrB c was discovered by the Multiple Observatories observatory using the radial velocity method. Its discovery was announced in 2016-10. Its semi-major axis is 0.41 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 102.54 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, rho CrB.

Its eccentricity, the extent to which the shape of the exoplanet's orbit departs from a perfect circle (Earth's is 0.0167, which is why the shape of Earth's orbit is circular rather than oval in appearance), is 0.052, which means that when rho CrB c is at is at its closest point to its host star, 0.39 astronomical units separates the two, and when it is at its farthest point, this number is 0.43. In the case of Earth, these numbers are 0.9832899 and 1.0167103 respectively.

The mass of rho CrB c is 25.00 times the mass of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, rho CrB c is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system rho CrB, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Fred Lawrence Whipple Observatory.
